intro: Galium cappadocicum, commonly known as Cappadocian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium cappadocicum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils.
